info.title: Repository Microservice - RESTful API
info.description: This webpage describes the RESTful interface of the KIT Data Manager Repository Microservice.

get.summary: Access audit information for a single resource.
get.description: List audit information for a resource in a paginated form. Sorting can be supported but is optional. If no sorting is supported it is recommended to return audit information sorted by version number in descending order. This endpoint is addressed if the caller provides content type 'application/vnd.datamanager.audit+json' within the 'Accept' header. If no audit support is enabled or no audit information are available for a certain resource, an empty result should be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the resource, if supported.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

put.description: Replace a resource by a new resource provided by the user.Putting a resource requires privileged access to the resource to patch or ADMIN permissions of the caller. Some resource fields might be protected and cannot be changed, e.g. the unique identifier. If at least one protected field in the new resource does not match with the current value, HTTP BAD_REQUEST will be returned before persisting the result.Attention: Due to the availability of PATCH, PUT support is optional! If a resource won't provide PUT support, HTTP NOT_IMPLEMENTED is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

delete.description: Delete a single resource. Deleting a resource typically requires the caller to have ADMIN permissions. In some cases, deleting a resource can also be available for the owner or other privileged users or can be forbidden. For resources whose deletion may affect other resources or internal workflows, physical deletion might not be possible at all. In those cases, the resource might be disabled/hidden but not removed from the database. This can then happen optionally at a later point in time, either automatically or manually.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

patch.description: Patch a single or multiple fields of a resource. Patching information are provided in JSON Patch format using Content-Type 'application/json-patch+json'. Patching a resource requires privileged access to the resource to patch or ADMIN permissions of the caller. Depending on the resource, single fields might be protected and cannot be changed, e.g. the unique identifier. If the patch tries to modify a protected field, HTTP BAD_REQUEST will be returned before persisting the result.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

get.summary: Access audit information for a single content information resource.
get.description: List audit information for a content information resource in a paginated form. Sorting can be supported but is optional. If no sorting is supported it is recommended to return audit information sorted by version number in descending order. This endpoint is addressed if the caller provides content type 'application/vnd.datamanager.audit+json' within the 'Accept' header. If no audit support is enabled or no audit information are available for a certain resource, an empty result should be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The resource version to access.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: A single tag assigned to certain content elements. Tags allow easy structuring and filtering of content associated to a resource.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

post.summary: Upload data for a data resource.
post.description: This endpoint allows to upload or assign data and content metadata related to the uploaded file to a resource identified by its id. Uploaded data will be stored at the configured backend, typically the local hard disk. Furthermore, it is possible to register data stored elsewhere by providing only a content URI within the content metadata.In any other case, providing content metadata is optional. Parts of the content metadata, e.g. content type or checksum, may be generated or overwritten after a file upload if they not already exist or if the configuration does not allow the user to provide particular content metadata entries, e.g. because a certain checksum digest is mandatory.All uploaded data can be virtually structured by providing the relative path where they should be accessible within the request URL. If a file at a given path already exists, there will be typically returned HTTP CONFLICT. If desired, overwriting of existing content can be enforced by setting the request parameter 'force' to  true. In that case, the existing file will be marked for deletion and is deleted after the upload operation has successfully finished. If the overwritten element only contains a reference URI, the entry is just replaced by the user provided entry.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Flag to indicate, that existing content at the same location should be overwritten.

file.description: The file to upload. If no file is uploaded, a metadata document must be provided containing a reference URI to the externally hosted data.

delete.summary: Remove a single content information element.
delete.description: This endpoint allows to remove single content information elements associated with a data resource. Removing content information elements including their content is restricted to privileged users, e.g. user with role ADMINISTRATOR or permission ADMINISTRATE.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

patch.summary: Patch a single content information element.
patch.description: This endpoint allows to patch single content information elements associated with a data resource. As most of the content information attributes are typically automatically generated their modification is restricted to privileged users, e.g. user with role ADMINISTRATOR or permission ADMINISTRATE. Users having WRITE permissions to the associated resource are only allowed to modify contained metadata elements or tags assigned to the content element.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier.

post.description: List all resources in a paginated and/or sorted form by example using an example document provided in the request body. The example is a normal instance of the resource. However, search-relevant top level primitives are marked as 'Searchable' within the implementation. For string values, '%' can be used as wildcard character. If the example document is omitted, the response is identical to listing all resources with the same pagination parameters. As well as listing of all resources, the number of total results might be affected by the caller's role.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The UTC time of the earliest update of a returned resource.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The UTC time of the latest update of a returned resource.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

post.description: List all content information in a paginated and/or sorted form by example using an example document provided in the request body. The example is a normal instance of the resource. However, search-relevant top level primitives are marked as 'Searchable' within the implementation. For string values, '%' can be used as wildcard character. If the example document is omitted, the response is identical to listing all resources with the same pagination parameters. As well as listing of all resources, the number of total results might be affected by the caller's role.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

get.description: List all resources in a paginated and/or sorted form. Possible queries are: listing with default values (X elements on first page sorted by database), listing page wise, sorted query page wise, and combinations of the options above. The total number of resources may differ between callers if single resources have access restrictions. Furthermore, anonymous listing of resources may or may not be supported.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The UTC time of the earliest update of a returned resource.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The UTC time of the latest update of a returned resource.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

post.description: Create a new resource and return it to the caller in case of success. Creating new resources may or may not be restricted to users possessing specific roles.

affiliations.description: Affiliation of the user, e.g. home institution.

items.description: Affiliation of the user, e.g. home institution.

Agent.description: An agent related to the creation or modification of a resource, e.g. the creator or a contributor.

contributionType.description: Controlled vocabulary value describing the contribution type, e.g. Producer.

publicationYear.description: Publication year (could be aquisition year, if publication year is not feasible)

subjects.description: One or more subjects describing the resource (recommended).

contributors.description: One or more contributors that have contributed to the resource (recommended).

dates.description: One or more dates related to the resource, e.g. creation or publication date (recommended).

relatedIdentifiers.description: One or more related identifiers the can be used to identify related resources, e.g. metadata, parts or derived resources (recommended).

descriptions.description: One or more description entries providing additional information, e.g. abstract or technical information (recommended).

geoLocations.description: One or more geolocation entries providing information about the location of the resource, e.g. storage or aquisition location (recommended).

language.description: The primary language of the resource. Possible codes are IETF BCP 47 or ISO 639-1.

alternateIdentifiers.description: One or more alternate identifiers the can be used to identify the resources in addition to the primary identifier.

sizes.description: Unstructured size information about the resource or its contents.

items.description: Unstructured size information about the resource or its contents.

formats.description: Format information about the resource or its contents. Preferably, mime types or file extensions are used.

items.description: Format information about the resource or its contents. Preferably, mime types or file extensions are used.

version.description: Version of the resource, e.g. major.minor.

fundingReferences.description: Funding information, e.g. funder, award number and title.

lastUpdate.description: Date at which the last update occured.

state.description: State information of the resource. After creation each resource is classified as VOLATILE

embargoDate.description: Date at which the embargo ends, e.g. after which the resource is published.

DataResource.description: Json representation of the resource to create.

value.description: The actual date of the entry.

type.description: Controlled vocabulary value describing the date type.

Date.description: A data entry of a resource.

description.description: The actual description as full text.

type.description: Controlled vocabulary value describing the description type.

Description.description: A description entry of a resource.

GeoLocation.description: Geo location information for a resource.

Identifier.description: One or more alternate identifiers the can be used to identify the resources in addition to the primary identifier.

Polygon.description: Geo location information as polygon. A polygon must consist of 4 or more points.

identifierType.description: Controlled vocabulary, e.g. INTERNAL or DOI.

relationType.description: Controlled vocabulary value describing the relation type, e.g. IS_PART_OF or IS_METADATA_FOR.

RelatedIdentifier.description: A related identifier for a resource.

Scheme.description: A scheme mapping consisting of namespace (schemeId) and schemeUri.

Subject.description: A subject of a resource, which can either be free text or a value URI.

relativePath.description: The relative path of this element under which the file content is accessible. The path is relative the the resource's 'data' url, e.g. http://hostname:port/api/v1/dataresources/resourceId/data/relativePath

version.description: The version of the metadata of this element. The metadata version may differ from the fileVersion.

fileVersion.description: The version of the file, e.g. the bitstream, associated with this element. The file version may differ from the version, which related to the metadata.

versioningService.description: Unqiue identifier of the versioning service under which this element is versioned (if configured).

contentUri.description: The URI where the content is located, e.g. pointing to the remote resource or a local file.

mediaType.description: The mediaType, either provided by the uploader or determined by the repository.

hash.description: The hash of the associated content, either provided by the user (for remote resources) or computed during upload by the repository.

size.description: The size of the associated bit stream in bytes.

additionalProperties.description: A key-value map containing additional metadata associated with this element.

metadata.description: A key-value map containing additional metadata associated with this element.

tags.description: A list of tags (strings) associated with this element. If a resource has a tag assigned, the tag can be used to access this (and all resources with this tag) directly.

items.description: A list of tags (strings) associated with this element. If a resource has a tag assigned, the tag can be used to access this (and all resources with this tag) directly.

ContentInformation.description: Json representation of the resource serving as example for the search operation. Typically, only first level primitive attributes are evaluated while building queries from examples.

JsonPatch.description: Json representation of a json patch document. The document must comply with RFC 6902 specified by the IETF.
